<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 813, 91]]<|/det|> In this experiment, you will determine the weight of a load using a balancing method. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 576, 122]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 1.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 128, 876, 260]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 274, 532, 293]]<|/det|> [a] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 305, 146, 323]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 305, 920, 355]]<|/det|> Place the metre rule on the pivot and adjust its position so that the metre rule is as near as possible to being balanced. The \(30.0 \text{cm}\) mark must be on the left-hand side of the pivot. **The metre rule must remain at this position on the pivot throughout the experiment.** <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 367, 920, 401]]<|/det|> Place the load \(\mathbf{P}\) on the metre rule so that its centre is exactly at the \(30.0 \text{cm}\) mark on the metre rule. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 413, 675, 432]]<|/det|> Record the distance \(a\) between the \(30.0 \text{cm}\) mark and the pivot. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 444, 920, 463]]<|/det|>
a = .................................................... $cm$ [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 475, 144, 494]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 475, 920, 510]]<|/det|> Place a load \(\mathbf{Q}\) on the metre rule and adjust the position of \(\mathbf{Q}\) so that the metre rule is as near as possible to being balanced. Load \(\mathbf{Q}\) has a weight \(Q\) of 1.0N. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 522, 181, 541]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 522, 920, 555]]<|/det|> Measure the distance \(b\) between the centre of load \(\mathbf{Q}\) and the pivot. Record the weight \(Q\) and the distance \(b\) in Table 1.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 570, 181, 587]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 568, 920, 602]]<|/det|> Repeat the procedure, with the load \(\mathbf{P}\) remaining at the \(30.0 \text{cm}\) mark, using \(Q\) values of \(2.0 \text{N}\), \(3.0 \text{N}\), \(4.0 \text{N}\) and \(5.0 \text{N}\). Record all the readings in the table. <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 616, 539, 632]]<|/det|> Table 1.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[280, 644, 717, 816]]<|/det|>
\(Q/\mathrm {N}\)\(b/\mathrm {cm}\)\(\frac {1}{Q}/\frac {1}{N}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 91]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 648, 91]]<|/det|> In this experiment, you will determine the focal length \(f\) of a lens. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 576, 122]]<|/det|> Carry out the following instructions, referring to Fig. 3.1. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[183, 129, 814, 256]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 274, 532, 293]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 305, 146, 324]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 305, 821, 324]]<|/det|> Place the centre of the lens at a distance \(u = 20.0 \text{cm}\) from the illuminated object. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 336, 918, 370]]<|/det|> Place the screen close to the lens and move it away from the lens until a sharply-focused image is formed on the screen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 383, 165, 401]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 383, 912, 401]]<|/det|> Measure the distance \(v\) from the centre of the lens to the screen. Record \(v\) in Table 3.1. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 414, 175, 432]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 414, 576, 432]]<|/det|> Calculate \(uv\) and record the result in the table. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 445, 175, 464]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 445, 920, 463]]<|/det|> Measure and record in the table the distance \(D\) from the illuminated object to the screen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 460, 917, 479]]<|/det|> [3] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 490, 146, 508]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 490, 918, 524]]<|/det|> Repeat the steps in **(a)** with the lens at a distance \(u = 30.0 \text{cm}\) from the illuminated object. Record all the readings in the table. <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 537, 539, 555]]<|/det|> Table 3.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[285, 567, 712, 648]]<|/det|>
\(u/\text{cm}\)\(v/\text{cm}\)\(uv/\text{cm}^2\)\(D/\text{cm}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 918, 120]]<|/det|>
A student is investigating whether the diameter of a pendulum bob affects the period of a pendulum. The period is the time taken for one complete oscillation of the pendulum. Fig. 4.1 shows a pendulum.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 448, 151]]<|/det|>
Fig. 4.2 shows one complete oscillation.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[262, 180, 400, 375]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[589, 216, 714, 400]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[267, 416, 336, 434]]<|/det|>
Fig. 4.1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 416, 688, 434]]<|/det|>
Fig. 4.2

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 515, 455, 532]]<|/det|>
The student has the following apparatus:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 546, 848, 580]]<|/det|>
pendulum bobs made of polystyrene with diameters 1 cm, 2 cm, 3 cm, 4 cm and 5 cm a supply of thread and a pair of scissors

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 577, 298, 594]]<|/det|>
clamp and stand

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 623, 920, 656]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to investigate whether the diameter of a pendulum bob affects the period of a pendulum. You are **not** required to carry out this experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 670, 218, 686]]<|/det|>
You should:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 701, 581, 718]]<|/det|>
* list additional apparatus that you would require

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 732, 655, 749]]<|/det|>
* explain briefly how you would carry out the investigation

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 764, 568, 781]]<|/det|>
* state the key variables that you would control

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 795, 918, 827]]<|/det|>
* draw a table with column headings, to show how you would display your readings (You are **not** required to enter any readings in the table.)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 842, 776, 858]]<|/det|>
* explain briefly how you would use your readings to reach a conclusion.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[435, 73, 561, 88]]<|/det|>
